intro: Dodecatheon pulchrum, commonly known as the showy peacock flower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that come in shades of pink, white, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 24 inches and features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a vibrant touch to natural landscapes.
